reasoning: Fundic gland polyps are relatively common incidental findings on endoscopy, estimated ~2-5 per 100,000 person-years based on endoscopic prevalence studies. Usually benign, often associated with PPI use.
source: Abraham SC et al. (2005). Fundic gland polyps: common features and distinguishing characteristics. Mod Pathol. 18(9):1169-1179
